{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Senior Communications Specialist",
  "description": "Christian Aid (CA) is a UK-based international NGO partnering with others to end poverty in Africa. At the heart of this vision is the transformation of the lives of people who live in poverty, empowering them to have a brighter future. Christian Aid works in more than 30 countries and has been operating in Nigeria since 2003. The Nigeria Country programme focuses on Community Health and HIV, Accountable Governance including humanitarian response and Gender.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Senior Communications Specialist

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja&nbsp;
Job type: Full-time
Type of contract:&nbsp;Fixed Term
Contracted hours:&nbsp;35

About the role


	The Senior Communications Specialist is a pivotal member of the Christian Aid Nigeria Country Programme, providing strategic and technical leadership on communications priorities for the Sustainable Entrepreneurship-Led Poultry Transformation Programme (SEPTP) &mdash; a Mastercard Foundation-funded initiative designed to empower young persons in Nigeria through inclusive and sustainable growth in the poultry value chain.
	SEPTP seeks to enhance the productivity, inclusivity, and profitability of Nigeria&rsquo;s poultry sector by empowering youth-led enterprises.


About you


	The role holder should have an education to Degree or equivalent in Mass Communication, Development Communication, Social Sciences, or their equivalent, minimum of 3 years of progressive experience in strategic or development communications within an INGO, donor-funded programme, or media environment, good editorial skills, high proficiency in written/spoken English and ability to translate complexities into material that is compelling, jargon-free and accessible.
	He/She should be proficient in digital communication tools, social media platforms, and content management systems, with experience leading media engagement, storytelling, and multimedia production, excellent time and project management skills, coupled with a high level of multitasking and situational awareness, basic understanding of document and database management.
	He/she should be proficient with all MS applications- Intermediate to advanced level, with substantial knowledge of supporting programmes and programme staff in international and national agencies, as well as good interpersonal, communication skills, and team building.
	The role holder should have demonstrable skills in donor visibility management (preferably Mastercard Foundation, FCDO, USAID, or equivalent donors), familiarity with working with faith-based institutions in Nigeria and post graduate qualification or equivalent in journalism and communication.
",

Senior Communications Specialist Job at Christian Aid (CA)




        
    

        
        Christian Aid (CA) is a UK-based international NGO partnering with others to end poverty in Africa. At the heart of this vision is the transformation of the lives of people who live in poverty, empowering them to have a brighter future. Christian Aid works in more than 30 countries and has been operating in Nigeria since 2003. The Nigeria Country programme focuses on Community Health and HIV, Accountable Governance including humanitarian response and Gender.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Communications Specialist

Job Location: Abuja 
Job type: Full-time
Type of contract: Fixed Term
Contracted hours: 35
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



About the role


	The Senior Communications Specialist is a pivotal member of the Christian Aid Nigeria Country Programme, providing strategic and technical leadership on communications priorities for the Sustainable Entrepreneurship-Led Poultry Transformation Programme (SEPTP) — a Mastercard Foundation-funded initiative designed to empower young persons in Nigeria through inclusive and sustainable growth in the poultry value chain.
	SEPTP seeks to enhance the productivity, inclusivity, and profitability of Nigeria’s poultry sector by empowering youth-led enterprises.


About you


	The role holder should have an education to Degree or equivalent in Mass Communication, Development Communication, Social Sciences, or their equivalent, minimum of 3 years of progressive experience in strategic or development communications within an INGO, donor-funded programme, or media environment, good editorial skills, high proficiency in written/spoken English and ability to translate complexities into material that is compelling, jargon-free and accessible.
	He/She should be proficient in digital communication tools, social media platforms, and content management systems, with experience leading media engagement, storytelling, and multimedia production, excellent time and project management skills, coupled with a high level of multitasking and situational awareness, basic understanding of document and database management.
	He/she should be proficient with all MS applications- Intermediate to advanced level, with substantial knowledge of supporting programmes and programme staff in international and national agencies, as well as good interpersonal, communication skills, and team building.
	The role holder should have demonstrable skills in donor visibility management (preferably Mastercard Foundation, FCDO, USAID, or equivalent donors), familiarity with working with faith-based institutions in Nigeria and post graduate qualification or equivalent in journalism and communication.
    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Project Management Officer",
  "description": "Unified Payment Services Limited is Nigeria&rsquo;s premier Payments &amp; Financial Technology company that operates as a shared infrastructure for the banking community in Nigeria and Payments Service Provider within and outside Nigeria, with a vision to be the most preferred e-payment service provider in Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Project Management Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Project Management Officer (PMO) will support the planning, execution, monitoring, and successful delivery of projects across the organization.
	This role involves tracking project progress, maintaining documentation, coordinating with stakeholders, and ensuring adherence to timelines, budgets, and standards.
	The PMO will help implement project management best practices, streamline reporting, and contribute to the effective governance of the project portfolio within a dynamic fintech environment.


Responsibilities


	Support project planning activities, including scope definition, scheduling, resource allocation, and budgeting.
	Monitor and track progress across multiple projects to ensure timely delivery and alignment with business objectives.
	Maintain and update project documentation including project charters, plans, risk logs, and status reports.
	Assist in standardizing project management methodologies, tools, and templates across the organization.
	Coordinate with project teams to ensure tasks are assigned, deadlines are met, and risks/issues are addressed proactively.
	Organize and facilitate project review meetings, stakeholder briefings, and status update sessions.
	Prepare and present periodic project reports, dashboards, and performance metrics to leadership and stakeholders.
	Support the implementation of project governance processes and compliance with internal policies.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure project alignment with strategic goals.
	Assist in post-project reviews, lessons learned, and continuous improvement initiatives.


Requirements
Education:


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Project Management, Business Administration, Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field.
	A Master&rsquo;s degree or certification in project management or business-related field is an advantage.


Experience:


	Minimum of 4 years of experience in a project management, project coordination, or PMO support role, preferably in a fintech or technology-driven environment.
	Basic understanding of fintech industry operations, products, and project delivery models is an added advantage.


Technical Skills:


	Proficiency in project management tools (e.g., MS Project, JIRA, Asana, Trello, Monday.com).
	Knowledge of project management methodologies such as Agile, Waterfall, or hybrid approaches.
	Familiarity with project tracking and performance reporting systems.
	Understanding of risk and issue management, stakeholder engagement, and change control processes.


Certifications:


	Certifications such as Certified Associate in Project Management (CAPM), PRINCE2 Foundation, or Agile Scrum Foundation are beneficial.


Soft Skills:


	Strong organizational and time-management skills.
	Effective communication and interpersonal skills for stakeholder engagement.
	Analytical mindset with a problem-solving orientation.
	High attention to detail and accuracy.
	Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;opeoluwa.oluyemi@up-ng.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2025-12-01",

Project Management Officer Job at Unified Payment Services Limited




        
    

        
        Unified Payment Services Limited is Nigeria’s premier Payments & Financial Technology company that operates as a shared infrastructure for the banking community in Nigeria and Payments Service Provider within and outside Nigeria, with a vision to be the most preferred e-payment service provider in Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Project Management Officer
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Project Management Officer (PMO) will support the planning, execution, monitoring, and successful delivery of projects across the organization.
	This role involves tracking project progress, maintaining documentation, coordinating with stakeholders, and ensuring adherence to timelines, budgets, and standards.
	The PMO will help implement project management best practices, streamline reporting, and contribute to the effective governance of the project portfolio within a dynamic fintech environment.


Responsibilities


	Support project planning activities, including scope definition, scheduling, resource allocation, and budgeting.
	Monitor and track progress across multiple projects to ensure timely delivery and alignment with business objectives.
	Maintain and update project documentation including project charters, plans, risk logs, and status reports.
	Assist in standardizing project management methodologies, tools, and templates across the organization.
	Coordinate with project teams to ensure tasks are assigned, deadlines are met, and risks/issues are addressed proactively.
	Organize and facilitate project review meetings, stakeholder briefings, and status update sessions.
	Prepare and present periodic project reports, dashboards, and performance metrics to leadership and stakeholders.
	Support the implementation of project governance processes and compliance with internal policies.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure project alignment with strategic goals.
	Assist in post-project reviews, lessons learned, and continuous improvement initiatives.


Requirements
Education:


	Bachelor’s degree in Project Management, Business Administration, Engineering, Information Technology, or a related field.
	A Master’s degree or certification in project management or business-related field is an advantage.


Experience:


	Minimum of 4 years of experience in a project management, project coordination, or PMO support role, preferably in a fintech or technology-driven environment.
	Basic understanding of fintech industry operations, products, and project delivery models is an added advantage.


Technical Skills:


	Proficiency in project management tools (e.g., MS Project, JIRA, Asana, Trello, Monday.com).
	Knowledge of project management methodologies such as Agile, Waterfall, or hybrid approaches.
	Familiarity with project tracking and performance reporting systems.
	Understanding of risk and issue management, stakeholder engagement, and change control processes.


Certifications:


	Certifications such as Certified Associate in Project Management (CAPM), PRINCE2 Foundation, or Agile Scrum Foundation are beneficial.


Soft Skills:


	Strong organizational and time-management skills.
	Effective communication and interpersonal skills for stakeholder engagement.
	Analytical mindset with a problem-solving orientation.
	High attention to detail and accuracy.
	Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: opeoluwa.oluyemi@up-ng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": ".NET Developer",
  "description": "Unified Payment Services Limited is Nigeria&rsquo;s premier Payments &amp; Financial Technology company that operates as a shared infrastructure for the banking community in Nigeria and Payments Service Provider within and outside Nigeria, with a vision to be the most preferred e-payment service provider in Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: .NET Developer
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Objective(s)


	We are looking for a skilled .NET Developer with at least 3 years of experience to join our dynamic team.
	The ideal candidate should have strong expertise in C#, .NET Framework/.NET Core, ASP.NET, and database management. You will be responsible for developing, testing, and maintaining high-performance applications, ensuring scalability, security, and reliability.


Duties &amp; Responsibilties


	Design, develop, and maintain scalable .NET applications using C#, ASP.NET MVC/Core.
	Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code following best practices.
	Develop RESTful APIs and integrate third-party APIs/services.
	Work with SQL Server / PostgreSQL / MySQL / Oracle to design and optimize database structures and queries.
	Implement authentication, authorization, and security best practices.
	Debug, troubleshoot, and resolve application issues.
	Participate in code reviews, agile development practices, and team discussions.
	Optimize application performance and scalability.
	Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and trends in .NET development.


Requirements
Education:


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
	4 - 6 years of hands-on experience in .NET Framework/.NET Core and C# development.
	Strong experience with ASP.NET MVC / ASP.NET Core / Web API.
	Proficiency in SQL Server / PostgreSQL / MySQL/Oracle, including writing complex queries, stored procedures, and indexing.
	Experience with Entity Framework (EF) / Dapper for database interactions.
	Knowledge of frontend technologies (JavaScript, HTML, CSS, Angular, React, or Vue.js) is a plus.
	Strong understanding of OOP, design patterns, and best coding practices.
	Ability to work in an agile development environment.
	Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
	Strong communication and teamwork skills.


Preferred Skills (Nice-to-Have):


	Experience with microservices architecture.
	Knowledge of Docker/Kubernetes.
	Experience in unit testing frameworks (xUnit, NUnit, Moq).


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;opeoluwa.oluyemi@up-ng.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

.NET Developer Job at Unified Payment Services Limited




        
    

        
        Unified Payment Services Limited is Nigeria’s premier Payments & Financial Technology company that operates as a shared infrastructure for the banking community in Nigeria and Payments Service Provider within and outside Nigeria, with a vision to be the most preferred e-payment service provider in Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: .NET Developer
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Objective(s)
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are looking for a skilled .NET Developer with at least 3 years of experience to join our dynamic team.
	The ideal candidate should have strong expertise in C#, .NET Framework/.NET Core, ASP.NET, and database management. You will be responsible for developing, testing, and maintaining high-performance applications, ensuring scalability, security, and reliability.


Duties & Responsibilties


	Design, develop, and maintain scalable .NET applications using C#, ASP.NET MVC/Core.
	Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code following best practices.
	Develop RESTful APIs and integrate third-party APIs/services.
	Work with SQL Server / PostgreSQL / MySQL / Oracle to design and optimize database structures and queries.
	Implement authentication, authorization, and security best practices.
	Debug, troubleshoot, and resolve application issues.
	Participate in code reviews, agile development practices, and team discussions.
	Optimize application performance and scalability.
	Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and trends in .NET development.


Requirements
Education:


	Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
	4 - 6 years of hands-on experience in .NET Framework/.NET Core and C# development.
	Strong experience with ASP.NET MVC / ASP.NET Core / Web API.
	Proficiency in SQL Server / PostgreSQL / MySQL/Oracle, including writing complex queries, stored procedures, and indexing.
	Experience with Entity Framework (EF) / Dapper for database interactions.
	Knowledge of frontend technologies (JavaScript, HTML, CSS, Angular, React, or Vue.js) is a plus.
	Strong understanding of OOP, design patterns, and best coding practices.
	Ability to work in an agile development environment.
	Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
	Strong communication and teamwork skills.


Preferred Skills (Nice-to-Have):


	Experience with microservices architecture.
	Knowledge of Docker/Kubernetes.
	Experience in unit testing frameworks (xUnit, NUnit, Moq).


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: opeoluwa.oluyemi@up-ng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Business Development Manager",
  "description": "Mapsi Group is a multi-sector enterprise offering services in car rentals and sales, logistics, security, CCTV surveillance, smart home automation, construction, and general contracting and supply.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Calabar, Cross River
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	We are seeking a results-driven Business Development Manager to lead strategic growth across our diverse business units.
	This is an on-site role.


Key&nbsp;Responsibilities


	Identify new markets, growth areas, industry trends, and potential strategic partnerships
	Research and contact potential clients to establish rapport and arrange meetings
	Develop and execute strategies for business growth and new market initiatives
	Prepare proposals and quotes, and move prospects through the sales funnel to close deals
	Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, partners, and stakeholders
	Collaborate with sales, marketing, and internal teams to align efforts and ensure successful implementation of growth opportunities
	Monitor market trends and competitor activity to inform strategic decisions
	Represent Mapsi Group at industry events, exhibitions, and networking forums
	Track performance metrics and report on business development outcomes.


Requirements


	A Master&rsquo;s Degree (MBA preferred) in Business Administration, Marketing, Management, or a related field with a minimum of 5 years experience in business development or a similar role
	OR a Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Management, Economics, or related disciplines with at least 8 years of proven experience in a similar capacity
	Strong understanding of both B2B and B2C markets
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills
	Ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment
	Willing to travel for official assignments on short notice.


Compensation


	Monthly salary: NGN250,000.00
	Attractive commission structure based on performance.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letter&nbsp;to:&nbsp;careers@mapsigroup.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Female candidates are highly encouraged to apply!",

  },

Business Development Manager Job at Mapsi Group




        
    

        
        Mapsi Group is a multi-sector enterprise offering services in car rentals and sales, logistics, security, CCTV surveillance, smart home automation, construction, and general contracting and supply.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Manager

Job Location: Calabar, Cross River
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	We are seeking a results-driven Business Development Manager to lead strategic growth across our diverse business units.
	This is an on-site role.


Key Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Identify new markets, growth areas, industry trends, and potential strategic partnerships
	Research and contact potential clients to establish rapport and arrange meetings
	Develop and execute strategies for business growth and new market initiatives
	Prepare proposals and quotes, and move prospects through the sales funnel to close deals
	Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, partners, and stakeholders
	Collaborate with sales, marketing, and internal teams to align efforts and ensure successful implementation of growth opportunities
	Monitor market trends and competitor activity to inform strategic decisions
	Represent Mapsi Group at industry events, exhibitions, and networking forums
	Track performance metrics and report on business development outcomes.


Requirements


	A Master’s Degree (MBA preferred) in Business Administration, Marketing, Management, or a related field with a minimum of 5 years experience in business development or a similar role
	OR a Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Management, Economics, or related disciplines with at least 8 years of proven experience in a similar capacity
	Strong understanding of both B2B and B2C markets
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills
	Ability to manage multiple projects in a fast-paced environment
	Willing to travel for official assignments on short notice.


Compensation


	Monthly salary: NGN250,000.00
	Attractive commission structure based on performance.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and cover letter to: careers@mapsigroup.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Note: Female candidates are highly encouraged to apply!    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Front Desk / Admin Support Officer",
  "description": "DEER Nigeria provides engineering services including energy efficiency and high-level energy management support. DEER Energy-on-Demand provides a flexible and easy way to manage all your energy needs. We safely deliver diesel, cooking gas, and accessories and provide solar support and electricity vending to keep your access to energy stable and sustainable.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Front Desk / Admin Support Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Maintain a tidy and welcoming reception area that reflects the company&rsquo;s corporate image.
	Manage incoming and outgoing correspondence, parcels, and deliveries.
	Provide support in preparing company materials and coordinating small-scale events or meetings.
	Assist in vendor management and procurement documentation.
	Liaise with service providers and ensure office utilities and equipment are functioning optimally.
	Support internal communications and dissemination of official memos.
	Provide general administrative and clerical support to all departments.
	Prepare meeting schedules, coordinate logistics, and record minutes.
	Manage incoming and outgoing correspondence, parcels, and deliveries etc.


Requirements


	Candidates must have at least an HND qualification
	Not less than 1 year of work experience in the same role.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated resume in PDF format to:&nbsp;hr@deernigeria.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only qualified candidates will be contacted and invited for an interview.",

Front Desk / Admin Support Officer Job at DEER Nigeria




        
    

        
        DEER Nigeria provides engineering services including energy efficiency and high-level energy management support. DEER Energy-on-Demand provides a flexible and easy way to manage all your energy needs. We safely deliver diesel, cooking gas, and accessories and provide solar support and electricity vending to keep your access to energy stable and sustainable.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Front Desk / Admin Support Officer

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Maintain a tidy and welcoming reception area that reflects the company’s corporate image.
	Manage incoming and outgoing correspondence, parcels, and deliveries.
	Provide support in preparing company materials and coordinating small-scale events or meetings.
	Assist in vendor management and procurement documentation.
	Liaise with service providers and ensure office utilities and equipment are functioning optimally.
	Support internal communications and dissemination of official memos.
	Provide general administrative and clerical support to all departments.
	Prepare meeting schedules, coordinate logistics, and record minutes.
	Manage incoming and outgoing correspondence, parcels, and deliveries etc.


Requirements


	Candidates must have at least an HND qualification
	Not less than 1 year of work experience in the same role.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their updated resume in PDF format to: hr@deernigeria.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only qualified candidates will be contacted and invited for an interview.
